Hello everyone,
I've been lurking here for quite awhile, but until now have=
n't had
much to contribute.  I'm David D'Ambrosio, one of Dr. Stanley's
stu=
dents and I will be presenting a paper on CPPNs and HyperNEAT at
this year'=
s GECCO.  The paper is avialble here
http://eplex.cs.ucf.edu/index.php?opti=
on=3Dcom_content&task=3Dview&id=3D14&Itemid=3D28#dambrosio.gecco07

I've be=
en pretty busy lately (grad school would be great it it weren't
for all the=
 classes) so I haven't had a chance to read through all the
responses yet, =
but overall they seem both supportive and informative.
 Anyways, I just wan=
ted to let everyone know that I will also be
releasing my source code in th=
e near future.  The core HyperNEAT is in
C# and built on top of Colin Green=
's excellent SharpNEAT package.  

I also noticed that Stephen Waits mentio=
ned a bit about visualizing
the hypercubes produced by the CPPNs.  I have a=
ctually come up with an
intuitive and meaningful way of doing this and I pl=
an on releasing
this as well.  This is also in C# but it should be able to =
interact
with any genome files from SharpNEAT, ANJI, or any other type of
g=
enome file that needs support.

As the others have said, if you have any qu=
estion I'd be happy to try
and answer them.

David
